title: What happened to the Black Zac skin and how do black skins make the game unstable?

replies.body: It was a clarity issue.It would be easy to miss him when he comes out of fog of war if you were focusing on something else.

Yup, this was the case. 

Black Zac was a placeholder texture from a while ago that accidentally wound up on the PBE.

We wouldn't be able to push this creation onto live due to several readability problems, including coming out of FoW and not being able to provide proper shading on the skin to aid with clarity and readability of the champion itself.
What about {{champion:56}} ?
Noc, Noc.
Who's there?
{{champion:91}} [LONGSWORDS](https://soundcloud.com/stephanosrex/rex-weighs-in-on-s6-talon/s-e69Qu)
Noc isn't completely black.
Is there no way to make a lighter grey version of this that wouldn't have readability problems?
It's not something we feel would be of a high enough quality, and not something we're looking to pursue at this time.
That's a pity, thanks for the responses though!
Not a problem!
you could try a mercury look? living liquid metal deathball flying at you from the fog of war is a terror.
Oooh. I like that idea!

Maybe like the Terminator from Terminator 2?

And his q could be a spike in stead of the usual animation.
To be honest, there needs to be something done about it, as it's a shame that we can't get cool-looking skins in dark palette.
We can still get darker palettes - Foresaken Jayce, for example, but there also needs to be a healthy mix of highlights/accents of color to balance it out.
Oh, right, I completely forgot about him. There's also Assassin Yi.

Yup! It's a tricky line to walk, so we're extra careful that the skin doesn't blend into the lane or the river. We also take colorblind players into consideration to make sure the blending doesn't occur in that case either! :]
Would you maybe consider a neon Zac skin? That could be black and red?
Potentially - Blood Moon?! :D

Yea but there's a lot of those, and they fit each time less with the original lore.
However, a Neon Strike Jax, made of black goo and elastic neon tubes on the frame...

So you're saying the exact same thing I said about how a black Shockblade Zed chroma skin would not be a hit against clarity, and you're still against the idea.

Feels good man.

Jk, it actually feels fucking terrible.
Zed relies on shadows as a big part of his kit, which is why a black Shockblade Zed isn't the best of ideas in terms of clarity.

The last time we discussed this, I brought up the point that Shockblade Zed uses shadows that are a mixture between blue and grey. Not black like his classic skin. But don't mind me. I doubt I can change your mind anyway.
